header_summary:
Keagan McClelland proposes adapting wallet policies to automatically convert tiny, impractical cryptocurrency amounts, known as dust outputs, into transaction fees, thereby enhancing user experience and benefiting miners without altering the blockchain protocol itself. This approach addresses user experience challenges and technical integration within wallets, underscoring the importance of application-level solutions in cryptocurrency usability and transaction efficiency. [Read more about dust outputs and wallet policies](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALeFGL0ddgS=qCsunoGwD2j6By4_bQpndX-oKn_wAQse3o+Sxg@mail.gmail.com/T/#m9a9ef4bd1e7a6795ec3c2abc18650a8b0ca2f292).

Weikeng Chen discusses the necessity of enhancing the programmability of Bitcoin through upgrades like SNARK verification opcodes to improve bridging solutions, ensuring the protocol's utility extends beyond data availability. This includes addressing privacy concerns, pivotal for Bitcoin's evolution, indicating a broader need for technological advancements to sustain the digital currency's ecosystem. [Explore the discussion on protocol challenges and BitVM technology](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/b0afc5f2-4dcc-469d-b952-03eeac6e7d1b@gmail.com/T/#m566d1a8e33d45280bb1713b04ead37b5dc0be515).

Hunter Beast et al. delve into the implications of quantum computing for Bitcoin, focusing on the development of quantum-resistant cryptographic methods and potential protocol modifications to secure the network against quantum threats. The conversation spans from the technical challenges of quantum computing to specific defensive strategies, underscoring the collaborative effort required to future-proof Bitcoin against these emerging technologies. [Learn about Bitcoin Improvement Proposals and quantum computing threats](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/62fd28ab-e8b5-4cfc-b5ae-0d5a033af057n@googlegroups.com/T/#m21c31e17f014053cfefcc6c810bfa1c1781f6a7a).

Andyschroder introduces a concept suitable as a Bitcoin Lightning Improvement Proposal (bLIP), focusing on integrating trusted contacts within BOLT12 without disrupting its core functionalities. This proposal highlights the optional nature of new features, ensuring the foundational integrity of BOLT12 remains intact for users opting out, suggesting a path for enhancing Bitcoin's Lightning Network while maintaining user choice and system stability. [Details on the bLIP and its implications for BOLT12 are available here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/expanding-on-bolt12/1167/2).

recent_posts.title: OP_KEEPCHANGE - mitigating dust outputs
recent_posts.summary:
- Dust outputs in cryptocurrency transactions pose user experience and technical policy challenges.
- Wallet policies could convert small dust outputs into extra transaction fees, benefiting miners.
- Implementing this requires user consent and careful integration into the wallet's interface.

recent_posts.title: Shielded CSV: Private and Efficient Client-Side Validation
recent_posts.summary:
- Bridging is identified as the primary challenge for protocol efficacy on Bitcoin.
- BitVM technology could aid, but further programmability upgrades are necessary.
- Introducing SNARK verification opcode could significantly enhance Bitcoin's privacy features.

recent_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussions aim to enhance Bitcoin's security against potential quantum computing threats.
- Proposals include soft forks and FALCON signatures to accommodate quantum advancements.
- The urgency of quantum-resistant methods for Bitcoin's security against quantum attacks is emphasized.

recent_posts.title: Expanding on BOLT12
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal is better suited as a bLIP, not an amendment to BOLT specifications.
- It introduces optional trusted contacts to BOLT12, preserving standard operation for non-adopters.
- Detailed proposal insights are provided at delvingbitcoin.org, enhancing BOLT12 without disrupting its core.

recent_posts.title: Proof-of-work based signet faucet
recent_posts.summary:
- A P2W address in testnet4 uses a script that limits signature size under 60 bytes.
- This technique adjusts difficulty and grinding necessity without altering consensus or adding operations.
- It underscores P2WSH's advantage for standard, efficient Pay to Proof of Work addresses implementation.

recent_posts.title: Hybrid Jamming Mitigation: Results and Updates
recent_posts.summary: - The document examines managing network reputation, focusing on preimage release responsibility.  - It discusses a bidirectional algorithm and the potential redundancy of incoming reputation signals.  - It also explores the effects of an outgoing-only reputation system on payment processing and network participation.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests quantum resistance for Bitcoin with a new signature algorithm.
- It initiates a series of BIPs to protect Bitcoin from quantum vulnerabilities.
- Community feedback is sought for the draft via a provided link for refinement.

active_posts.title: Shielded CSV: Private and Efficient Client-Side Validation
active_posts.summary:
- Liam Eagen and Robin Linus introduce Shielded CSV for enhanced cryptocurrency privacy.
- Shielded CSV reduces blockchain data footprint, elevating transaction privacy and efficiency.
- It uses minimal data, increasing privacy and scalability in cryptocurrency transactions.

active_posts.title: OP_KEEPCHANGE - mitigating dust outputs
active_posts.summary:
- James Ferguson introduces "OP_KEEPCHANGE" to improve Bitcoin's efficiency by reducing transaction dust.
- The mechanism credits small transaction leftovers to the recipient, aiming to decrease blockchain bloat and enhance privacy.
- "OP_KEEPCHANGE" offers benefits like preventing value erosion and supporting a more equitable Bitcoin system through technical adjustments.

active_posts.title: Proving UTXO set inclusion in zero-knowledge
active_posts.summary:
- The `utxozkp` tool enhances LN privacy by providing UTXO set inclusion proof without detail disclosure.
- Current `utxozkp` version generates 1.4 MB proofs in 6 minutes, with quick 300 ms verifications.
- Feedback is sought for `utxozkp`, aiming for future developments and performance optimizations.

active_posts.title: SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories
active_posts.summary:
- The SuperScalar mechanism improves Bitcoin Lightning Network's liquidity without needed blockchain changes.
- It uses Decker-Wattenhofer mechanisms, timeout trees, and laddering for secure, efficient operations.
- This approach offers scalability and flexibility in managing liquidity, tailored to user activity and network conditions.

active_posts.title: Estimating Likelihood for Lightning Payments to be (in)feasible
active_posts.summary:
- Rene Pickhardt is developing a theory on Lightning Network's payment channels.
- His work shifts understanding from independent liquidity models to bimodal distributions.
- Pickhardt's methods offer new insights into estimating payment success rates on the network.

today_in_history_posts.title: Is it possible for there to be two chains after a hard fork?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Gavin Andresen discusses using the old Bitcoin version post-hard fork.
- He highlights a scenario where 5% of miners could sustain a separate fork.
- The potential for exploiting price differences between forks is questioned.

today_in_history_posts.title: Onion routing strawman proposal
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell shared test onion routing code on GitHub.
- The code uses AES128, HMAC SHA256, and Bitcoin EC with ECDH encryption methods.
- Rusty requests a crypto review of the code.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scalability aims for 1 billion users with 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks." - These entities range from federated sidechains to smart contract-based coinpools.
- Focus on Layer 2 solutions and regulatory compliance for secure, scalable Bitcoin infrastructure.
